intro: Seriphidium dumosum, commonly known as the desert hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Mediterranean and Middle East. It is a perennial herb with a sprawling, bushy growth habit, featuring dense clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss in dry environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Seriphidium dumosum is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and is a key component of desert ecosystems.
